isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9400, AND 9900 MODELS - HEATER AND AIR CONDITIONER - TROUBLESHOOTING - Heater-Cab With Day Cab and Box Sleeper

svcproc.title: Heater-Cab With Day Cab and Box Sleeper

table.title: Heater-Cab With Day Cab and Box Sleeper

entry.para: Do either of the heater box blower motors run when the control switch is moved to low, medium, or high?
Remove heater control relay (463-R5). Turn ignition switch on and measure voltage from circuit 13AK to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13AK, then repair.
At (463-R5) measure voltage from circuit 13AK to 13-GT.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 13-GT, 77-G, 58-GA, or 11-G to right dash gnd stud, then repair.
Remove fuse F1-A and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F1-A, and measure voltage at circuit 14AX to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14AX or 14AW, then repair.
At heater control socket (463-R5), measure voltage from circuit 75H to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75H or 75, then repair.
With 12 volts applied to terminals 85 and 86 of heater control relay, measure resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Replace defective heater control relay at (463-R5).
Re-install heater control relay at (463-R5), and disconnect connector (11) and (12). Turn ignition switch on, and at connector (11) measure voltage from circuit 75J to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75J or 75S, then repair.
At connector (12) measure voltage from circuit 75B to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75B, then repair.
Does the blower motor connected to circuit 75F function in low, medium, and high switch positions?
At control switch that mates with connector (11), measure resistance from terminal C to A with switch in the low speed setting.
At control switch that mates with connector (11), measure resistance from terminal C to D with switch in the medium speed setting.
At control switch that mates with connector (11), measure resistance from terminal C to A with switch in the medium speed setting.
At control switch that mates with connector (11), measure resistance from terminal C to B with switch in the high speed settings.
At control switch that mates with connector (11) measure resistance from terminal C to E with switch in low, medium and high speed settings.
Reconnect connector (11). Does the blower motor connected to circuit 75F function in low and medium switch positions?
Disconnect conn. (27) from resistor & thermofuse assembly. Turn ignition on and place control switch in the low position. Measure voltage from circuit 75C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75C, then repair.
Place control switch in the medium position, and at (27) measure voltage from circuit 75D to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75D, then repair.
Remove high speed relay 1 (462-R2), turn ignition switch to on, place control switch in the high position, and measure voltage from circuit 75E to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75E, then repair.
At (462-R2) measure voltage from circuit 75E to 75-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75-GB, 75-GC, 50-GB, or 11-G to right dash panel ground stud, then repair.
At (462-R2) measure voltage from circuit 75A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75A, then repair.
Disconnect circuit 75-G from blower motor 1. Install jumper wire at (462-R2) circuit 75A to 75F. At 75F (blower motor end) measure voltage to ground.
At blower motor end, 75F to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75F, then repair.
With jumper still installed, measure voltage at blower motor 1 from circuit 75F to 75-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75-G, or 11-G to right dash panel ground stud, then repair.
With jumper still installed, briefly touch wire of circuit 75-G to blower motor 1 and note if motor runs.
Disconnect conn. (27) from resistor and thermofuse assembly. Move jumper at (462-R2) to jumper between circuits 75T to 75-GB.
At connector (27) measure resistance from circuit 75T to gnd.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75T, then repair.
Bench test relay (462-R2) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A of high speed relay 1.
Bench test relay (462-R2) by applying +12 volts to pin 86, gnd. to pin 85, and measuring resistance between terminals 30 and 87.
At resistor and thermofuse assy. (27), measure resistance from terminal 1 to 2.
Replace defective resistor and thermofuse assembly.
At resistor and thermofuse assy. (27), measure resistance from terminals 1 to 3, and 1 to 4 to verify that there is no open circuit condition.
Replace defective resistor and thermofuse assembly.
At control switch that mates with connector (12), measure resistance from terminal C to A with switch in the low speed setting.
At control switch that mates with connector (12), measure resistance from terminal C to D with switch in the medium speed setting.
At control switch that mates with connector (12), measure resistance from terminal C to A with switch in the medium speed setting.
At control switch that mates with conn. (12), measure resistance from terminal C to B with switch in the high speed setting.
At control switch that mates with connector (12), measure resistance from terminal C to E with switch in low, medium, and high speed settings.
Reconnect connector (12). Does the blower motor connected to circuit 75P function in low and medium switch positions?
Disconnect connector (28) from resistor and thermofuse assembly. Turn ignition on and place control switch in the low position. Measure voltage from circuit 75L to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75L, then repair.
Place control switch in the medium position, and at (28) measure voltage from circuit 75M to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75M, then repair.
Remove high speed relay 2 (462-R3), turn ignition switch to on, place control switch in the high position, and measure voltage from circuit 75N to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75N, then repair.
At (462-R3) measure voltage from circuit 75N to 75-GC.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75-GC, 50-GB, or 11-G to right dash panel ground stud, then repair.
Remove fuse F1-C and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F1-C, and at F1-C measure voltage from circuit 14Z to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14Z, then repair.
At (462-R3) measure voltage from circuit 75K to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75K, then repair.
Disconnect circuit 75-GA from blower motor 2. Install jumper wire at (462-R3) circuit 75K to 75P. At 75P (blower motor end) measure voltage to ground.
At blower motor end, 75P to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75P, then repair.
With jumper still installed, measure voltage at blower motor 2 from circuit 75P to 75-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75-GA, or 11-GB to right dash panel ground stud, then repair.
With jumper still installed, briefly touch wire of circuit 75-GA to blower motor 2 and note if motor runs.
Disconnect conn. (28) from resistor and thermofuse assembly. Move jumper at (462-R3) to jumper between circuits 75R to 75-GC.
At connector (28) measure resistance from circuit 75R to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75R, then repair.
Bench test relay (462-R3) by measuring resistance from terminal 30 to 87A of high speed relay 2.
Bench test relay (462-R3) by applying +12 volts to pin 86, gnd. to pin 85, and measuring resistance between terminals 30 and 87.
At resistor and thermofuse assembly near connector (28), measure resistance from terminal 1 to 2.
Replace defective resistor and thermofuse assembly.
At resistor and thermofuse assembly near connector (28), measure resistance from terminals 1 to 3, and 1 to 4 to verify that there is no open circuit condition.
Replace defective resistor and thermofuse assembly.
Cab heater circuits and components check good.
